stem: A 41-year-old client with Graves' disease is brought to the ED after undergoing an emergency appendectomy. Based on the documentation in the Endocrine Emergency & Continuous ECG Flowsheet tab, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Acute post-operative hypermetabolic crisis.
Background: History of Graves' disease. Client has been poorly compliant with Methimazole.
Assessment: Client is extremely agitated, diaphoretic, and tremulous.
Recommendation: Immediate thyroid suppression and sedation.

tabs.title: ECG & Metabolic Flowsheet

actionOptions.text: Apply cooling blankets and ice packs to the groin and axilla
Apply warm blankets to treat shivering

parameterOptions.text: Cardiac rhythm (Atrial Fibrillation vs Sinus Tachycardia)
Presence of a positive Trousseau sign

rationale.correct: This is a classic Thyroid Storm (c1) often triggered by a stressful event like surgery. Symptoms include extreme fever (105.2°F), severe tachycardia (162 bpm), AFib, and delirium. The priority is to drop the temperature (a1) and control the HR/sympathetic surge with beta-blockers (a2). Constant monitoring of temperature (p1) and heart rhythm (p2) is critical for preventing heart failure/arrest.
clinicalPearls: In thyroid storm, DO NOT give Aspirin for the fever—it can displace thyroid hormone from binding proteins and worsen the storm. Use Acetaminophen.
Thyroid storm has a high mortality rate due to heart failure from the high metabolic demand.
Propranolol is unique because it blocks the peripheral conversion of T4 to the more active T3.

questionTrap.trap: Choosing Dantrolene (MH treatment) because of the high temperature.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Dantrolene is for Malignant Hyperthermia (caused by anesthesia/succinylcholine). If the history mentions Graves' or hyperthyroidism, it's Thyroid Storm.
